question.text: Which of the following statements is incorrect with respect to sickle cell anaemia?

options.text: Homozygous individuals for HbA show the diseased character.
Heterozygous individuals are affected as well as carriers.
Homozygous individuals for HbS remain unaffected.
Homozygous individuals for HbS exhibit sickle cell trait.

solution.text:
Sickle cell anaemia is an autosomal recessive disease. This disease is controlled by a pair of alleles: HbA (normal dominant allele) and HbS (affected recessive allele).

Both male and female have either of the three genotypes:

1.  HbA HbA: Normal phenotype.

2.  HbA HbS: Normal phenotype.

3.  HbS HbS: Diseased phenotype.
